summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to attorneys Marc A. Weinstein and Andrew Tomback, following up on requests for prior wills, photographs, and videos related to the Epstein estate. The emails discuss the status of these document requests and scheduling.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.context: Partner and Co-Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, representing a client (likely the Epstein estate or an associate) in correspondence with federal prosecutors regarding document requests.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on email correspondence with federal prosecutors regarding document requests related to the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense attorneys to follow up on document requests (prior wills, photographs, videos) related to the Epstein estate investigation.

connections.description: Prosecutor corresponding with defense attorney regarding document production requests in an investigation, likely related to the Epstein estate.
Prosecutor corresponding with defense attorney regarding document production requests.

events.title: Follow-up on Epstein Estate Document Requests
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex follows up with defense attorneys Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback regarding outstanding requests for prior wills, photographs, and videos from the Epstein estate, originally made in December 2019.

events.title: Attorney Response on Document Request Timeline
events.description: Marc Weinstein responds to a prosecutor's inquiry, stating he should be able to provide an update on the request for prior wills by Thursday (January 9, 2020).

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the SDNY were actively seeking 'prior wills' and 'photographs and videos' from the Epstein estate as of January 2020.
The document requests were initially made in December 2019, indicating an ongoing investigation or proceeding related to Epstein's estate after his death.
Defense attorneys Marc A. Weinstein and Andrew Tomback were representing the interests of the estate or associated clients in responding to these federal subpoenas or requests.
The correspondence shows procedural follow-up and negotiation over document production timelines between prosecutors and defense counsel.
